articles.title: DPRK Holidays to Be Commemorated in Ethiopia
DPRK Holidays to Be Commemorated in Egypt
E-Library and Gymnasium of Kim Chaek University of Technology Inaugurated
articles.content:
DPRK Holidays to Be Commemorated in Egypt 
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Egyptian preparatory committee to commemorate the Day of the Sun and February 16 was formed in Cairo on Jan. 17.
 Youssef Amin Wali, vice-chairman of the National Democratic Party of Egypt, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee and Siham Ahmad Mugahed, chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, and Muhammad al Husseini al Akad, vice-minister of Agriculture, vice-chairmen of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee set the commemoration period from Jan. 17 to Apr. 17 and decided to hold colorful functions including a meeting, a photo and book exhibition and a film show in this period.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Favored in Different Countries
11th Sports Contest of Officials of National Institutions Opens
16th Individual Contest for "Feb. 16 Art Prize" Opens
Reception Given for Russian Diplomats
KCNA Urges U.S. to Remove Obstacle to Six-Party Talks
Arbitrariness of GNP Condemned in S. Korea
Suppression of Hanchongryon Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Arbitrariness of GNP Condemned in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Pusan Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea reportedly made public a statement on Jan. 20 denouncing the clan of the Grand National Party for its arbitrariness over the "local autonomy election".
 On Jan. 19 the GNP clan, having majority seats at the Pusan City Assembly, surprisingly passed a "bill on revising the enactment of fixing electoral districts" through the assembly in a bid to prevail over the election this year, the statement said, denouncing it as an undemocratic act.
 It underscored the need to take all-people action to punish the GNP, a party that embezzled a truck load of money, a pro-American conservative party and a party opposed to the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Outrages of Ultra-Right Conservatives Criticized in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of Hanchongryon Flailed in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) and the People's Solidarity for Repealing the "National Security Law" reportedly called a press conference at Yonsei University on Jan. 19 in protest against the security authorities' suppression of Hanchongryon.
 A press release read out at the conference said that it is a disgrace and a behavior of swimming against the trend of the times that the security authorities issued a notice to leading members of Hanchongryon to appear in security organs on charges of violating the NSL at the time when the international community is protesting against the unreasonable labelling of Hanchongryon as an "enemy-benefitting organization."    
 People from all walks of life will not remain an onlooker to the suppression of Hanchongryon, the press release said, stressing that they will fight until the NSL is abrogated.

articles.title: Repeal of Agreement on "Strategic Flexibility" Urged
U.S. and S. Korean Warhawks' Moves for War against DPRK Flayed
articles.content:
Repeal of Agreement on "Strategic Flexibility" Urged
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea made public a statement "Immediately repeal the agreement on strategic flexibility between south Korea and U.S." on Jan. 20, according to a news report.
 Referring to the fact that the U.S. and south Korean authorities officially agreed to allow the "strategic flexibility" of the U.S. forces stationed in south Korea at the "strategic dialogue for partnership of alliance" held from Jan. 19 to 20, the statement said:
 The U.S. purpose for "strategic flexibility" is to enhance the role of its forces in south Korea and use the south Korean army as its bullet-shields.
 The agreement makes it clear that peace of the Korean Peninsula can never be achieved as long as the U.S. forces remain in south Korea.
 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should repeal at once the agreement which will plunge the whole Korean Peninsula into a whirlpool of war.
 The Korean nation will surely unite closer under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration to frustrate the U.S. moves to ignite a war on the peninsula and repeal the agreement with its struggle and drive the U.S. forces out of this land to the last.

articles.title: U.S. Imperialists Threaten Peace in Korean Peninsula, Says Rodong Sinmun
Ten Best Athletes Selected
Korea Food Trading Company
Greetings to PM of India
articles.content:
Korea Food Trading Company
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Korea Food Trading Company in Songyo District, Pyongyang, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, has produced many kinds of quality foodstuffs.
 Very popular among its products are Pyongyang Soju (spirits), cold noodle (made with acorn, buckwheat and other materials), soybean paste, soy sauce and Kangso mineral water.    
 Large quantities of its products have been exported to China, Mongolia, Australia, New Zealand and other countries and areas of the world.
 In particular, several hundred thousand bottles of Pyongyang Soju, traditional liquor indigenous to Korea, are sold in various countries annually.
 The foodstuffs, which are made with plants which grow free from environmental pollution and are not based on  gene variation technology, are thick in national odor and famous among the overseas Koreans and foreigners.    
 The company, founded in Juche 81(1992), has scores of production and supplying factories such as the Pyongyang Soju Factory and Pyongyang Essential Foodstuff Factory.

articles.title: Greetings to President of India
articles.content:
Greetings to PM of India
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Manmohan Singh, prime minister of India, on the occasion of the 56th day of the Republic of India.
 The message sincerely wished him and the Indian people greater success in their work for building independent and prosperous India and expressed the conviction that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to expand and develop in the days ahead.

articles.title: Greetings to Australian Governor-General
articles.content:
Greetings to President of India
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, president of India, on the occasion of the 56th day of the Republic of India.
 The message expressed the conviction that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to expand and develop in the common interests of the two peoples and sincerely wished him greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity and development of the country.
